Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The Metropolitan Museum's Excavations at Nishapur
Description: This is a remarkably elaborate and fine example of a little-known type of ewer. Of special note are the pomegranate finial on the handle and the scenes on the body, which include a man and a saluki hunting dog chasing a hare, and a man fighting a lion, both set against a background of circular, spiraling floral scrolls. The Arabic inscriptions on the neck and shoulder read: "With auspiciousness, blessing, prosperity and joy," and "With auspiciousness, blessing, joy, happiness, and peace."
Provenance: 1937, excavated at Tepe Madrasa in Nishapur, Iran by the Metropolitan Museum of Art's expedition
1938, acquired by the Museum in the division of finds
